definitions.definition: (grammar) The perfect tense, or a form in that tense.
A perfect score; the achievement of finishing a stage or task with no mistakes.
Having all of its parts in harmony with a common purpose.
definitions.example: That bucket with the hole in the bottom is a poor bucket, but it is perfect for watering plants.

definitions.definition: Without fault or mistake; thoroughly skilled or talented.
Excellent and delightful in all respects.
Of a number: equal to the sum of its proper divisors.
definitions.example: 6 is perfect because the sum of its proper divisors, 1, 2, and 3, which is 6, is equal to the number itself.

definitions.definition: (grammar, of a tense or verb form) Representing a completed action.
Of flowers, having both male parts (stamens) and female parts (carpels).
Of a set: equal to its set of limit points, i.e. set A is perfect if A=A'.
Describing an interval or any compound interval of a unison, octave, or fourths and fifths that are not tritones.
(of a cocktail) Made with equal parts of sweet and dry vermouth.
definitions.example: a perfect Manhattan; a perfect Rob Roy

definitions.definition: To make perfect; to improve or hone.
definitions.example: I am going to perfect this article.

definitions.definition: To take an action, usually the filing of a document in the correct venue, that secures a legal right.
definitions.example: perfect an appeal; perfect an interest; perfect a judgment
